Class dominoes.BoneYard 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----dominoes.BoneYard
public class BoneYard
extends Object
This class represents the boneyard, or the collection of bones that are yet to be picked by a player. The boneyard constructs Bone objects for players to use, lets players draw bones, responds to questions about how many bones are left, etc.

BoneYard(int)
Construct bones with a maximum number of dots, top, specified by the constructor.

draw()
Let a bone be drawn from the boneyard, or return null if there are no bones.
size()
The number of bones left in the boneyard.

BoneYard 
  public BoneYard(int top)
Construct bones with a maximum number of dots, top, specified by the constructor. Bones are constructed in the order (0,0), (0,1), ...,(top-1, top), (top, top).
Parameters:
top - The maximum number of dots on any bone in the bone yard.

draw 
  public Bone draw()
Let a bone be drawn from the boneyard, or return null if there are no bones.
Returns:
a bone from the boneyard, or null if there are no more bones available.
size 
  public int size()
The number of bones left in the boneyard.
Returns:
the number of bones left in the boneyard.
